alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 20 at 1:57PM MDT until June 22 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton WY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. For the Wind River Basin...including Riverton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River at Riverton. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor flooding downstream along left bank near Black Bridge begins. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along the right and left banks upstream of the Highway 789 Bridge. Agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area intensifies. At 10.0 feet, Extensive agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area. Water begins to encroach homes along the right bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to rise above flood stage overnight, cresting near 9.5 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It is forecast to fall below flood stage on Thursday and decrease to just over 7 feet by the weekend. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
